<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===-- ExpandVariadicsPass.cpp --------------------------------&#42;- C++ -&#42;-=//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is an optimization pass for variadic functions. If called from codegen,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it can serve as the implementation of variadic functions for a given target.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The strategy is to turn the ... part of a variadic function into a va&#95;list</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and fix up the call sites. The majority of the pass is target independent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The exceptions are the va&#95;list type itself and the rules for where to store</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variables in memory such that va&#95;arg can iterate over them given a va&#95;list.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The majority of the plumbing is splitting the variadic function into a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// single basic block that packs the variadic arguments into a va&#95;list and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a second function that does the work of the original. That packing is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// exactly what is done by va&#95;start. Further, the transform from ... to va&#95;list</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replaced va&#95;start with an operation to copy a va&#95;list from the new argument,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which is exactly a va&#95;copy. This is useful for reducing target-dependence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A va&#95;list instance is a forward iterator, where the primary operation va&#95;arg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is dereference-then-increment. This interface forces significant convergent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// evolution between target specific implementations. The variation in runtime</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// data layout is limited to that representable by the iterator, parameterised</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// by the type passed to the va&#95;arg instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Therefore the majority of the target specific subtlety is packing arguments</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into a stack allocated buffer such that a va&#95;list can be initialised with it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and the va&#95;arg expansion for the target will find the arguments at runtime.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The aggregate effect is to unblock other transforms, most critically the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// general purpose inliner. Known calls to variadic functions become zero cost.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Consistency with clang is primarily tested by emitting va&#95;arg using clang</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then expanding the variadic functions using this pass, followed by trying</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to constant fold the functions to no-ops.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Target specific behaviour is tested in IR - mainly checking that values are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// put into positions in call frames that make sense for that particular target.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There is one &quot;clever&quot; invariant in use. va&#95;start intrinsics that are not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// within a varidic functions are an error in the IR verifier. When this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transform moves blocks from a variadic function into a fixed arity one, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// moves va&#95;start intrinsics along with everything else. That means that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// va&#95;start intrinsics that need to be rewritten to use the trailing argument</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are exactly those that are in non-variadic functions so no further state</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is needed to distinguish those that need to be rewritten.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/expandvariadics-h">llvm/Transforms/IPO/ExpandVariadics.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Instances of this class encapsulate the target-dependant behaviour as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function of triple. Implementing a new ABI is adding a case to the switch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in create(llvm::Triple) at the end of this file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This class may end up instantiated in TargetMachine instances, keeping it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// here for now until enough targets are implemented for the API to evolve.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Module implements getFunction() which returns nullptr on missing declaration</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and getOrInsertFunction which creates one when absent. Intrinsics.h only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implements getDeclaration which creates one when missing. Checking whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// an intrinsic exists thus inserts it in the module and it then needs to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// deleted again to clean up.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The right name for the two functions on intrinsics would match Module::,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but doing that in a single change would introduce nullptr dereferences</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// where currently there are none. The minimal collateral damage approach</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// would split the change over a release to help downstream branches. As it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is unclear what approach will be preferred, implementing the trivial</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function here in the meantime to decouple from that discussion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-expandvariadics-cpp-/#af4540c0cbec2275709abb4da6a19ff0a"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-expandvariadics-cpp-/#af4540c0cbec2275709abb4da6a19ff0a">getPreexistingDeclaration</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &#42;M, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/intrinsic/#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">Intrinsic::ID</a> Id,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;Type &#42;&gt;</a> Tys = &#123;&#125;) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Tys.empty())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/intrinsic/#aa1731508126b77035ab3ba9d71d5374b">Intrinsic::getDeclarationIfExists</a>(M, Id);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;FT = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/intrinsic/#aca1828635e30f34e4958afeb5541766e">Intrinsic::getType</a>(M-&gt;getContext(), Id, Tys);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/intrinsic/#aa1731508126b77035ab3ba9d71d5374b">Intrinsic::getDeclarationIfExists</a>(M, Id, Tys, FT);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-expandvariadics-cpp-/expandvariadics"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-expandvariadics-cpp-/expandvariadics/#a134c341d80127bc7b6d97367c75f1ee2">ExpandVariadics</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulepass/#a723659a08d210f4f566887bda3f9f976">ModulePass</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The pass construction sets the default to optimize when called from middle</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end and lowering when called from the backend. The command line variable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// overrides that. This is useful for testing and debugging. It also allows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// building an applications with variadic functions wholly removed if one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// has sufficient control over the dependencies, e.g. a statically linked</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// clang that has no variadic function calls remaining in the binary.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The strategy is to allocate a call frame containing the variadic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// arguments laid out such that a target specific va&#95;list can be initialized</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with it, such that target specific va&#95;arg instructions will correctly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iterate over it. This means getting the alignment right and sometimes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// embedding a pointer to the value instead of embedding the value itself.</span></CodeLine>
